tool.name: MiClip
tool.description: Identify Binding Sites in CLIP-Seq Data

param.name: input_file
param.label: Input File
param.help: Input SAM File. Use Bam to Sam converter if Input file is in Bam format.

param.name: control_file
param.label: Control File
param.help: Control experiment without crosslinking for distinguishing SNPs.

param.name: suffix
param.label: Suffix of Paired-End Read
param.help: Change only if Paired-End Reads. See Manual for more details.

param.name: step
param.label: Bin Step Size
param.help: In the first HMM, all clusters will be divided into bins of the same length of step bp.

param.name: maxbin
param.label: Max Number of Reads per Bin
param.help: Maximum number of Reads in a Bin or on a Base.

param.name: emperical
param.label: Emperical
param.help: Used in model fitting in the first HMM. Default is 'auto'.

param.name: model_cut
param.label: Mixure Model Cutoff
param.help: Cutoff for Fitting the mixture model in the Second HMM.

param.name: max_iter
param.label: Max Number of HMM Iterations
param.help: The Maximum number of Iterations for both HMM iterations.

tool.help:
**Description**
Cross-linking immunoprecipitation coupled with high-throughput sequencing (CLIP-Seq) has made it possible to identify targeting sites of RNA-binding proteins in various cell culture systems and tissue types on a genome-wide scale. Here we present MiClip,a novel model-based approach to identify high-confidence protein-RNA binding sites in CLIP-Seq datasets. This approach assigns confidence value to each binding site on a probabilistic basis. The MiClip package can be flexibly applied to analyze both HITS-CLIP data and PAR-CLIP data.
